He felt a pang of insecurity, questioning if they were moving on without him.

Scenario:

He woke up abruptly, his heart pounding like a kick drum in his chest. The clock read 3:17 AM. He listened intently, fearing the silence would be broken again by that chilling noise he'd heard earlier—the one that sounded eerily like his wife's cries for help from the bathroom down the hall. But tonight, there was only an unsettling stillness, save for the distant hum of their old refrigerator. His breath caught as he noticed the faint glow seeping from beneath the bathroom door, a light he hadn't left on. He swung his legs out of bed, hands trembling slightly, and stepped onto the cold hardwood floor. Each creak underfoot seemed deafening as he inched closer to the bathroom. The door groaned softly as it opened, revealing an empty room bathed in harsh fluorescent light. But something was off—the shower curtain was pulled taut across the tub, hiding what lay behind. His heart hammered wildly now, his fear threatening to consume him as he reached out a shaky hand and grabbed the curtain's edge. With one swift pull, it would all be revealed.
Generated Assessment: It fucking sucks when you're trying to get some rest, and your mind is always racing with worst-case scenarios. You hear this weird noise in the middle of the night, and suddenly your entire body goes into high alert. It’s like your brain is playing a loop of every bad thing that could happen, even though you know deep down it’s probably just the pipes or something. But sometimes, those little noises can turn into full-blown nightmares. And I’m not talking about just any nightmares; I’m talking about the ones where everything feels so real, like if you close your eyes, you’ll wake up right there in the middle of whatever fucked-up scenario your brain has cooked up for you. That’s what happened last night. I was lying in bed, trying to relax, but my heart was racing like a jackrabbit on steroids. Every creak of the house felt like a warning sign, every shadow seemed like a monster lurking in the dark. I couldn’t shake the feeling that something was seriously wrong, and it wasn’t until I got out of bed and crept towards the bathroom that things started to feel even more surreal. The bathroom looked normal at first glance, but then I saw that the shower curtain was bunched up in front of the tub, and I thought to myself, “What the fuck? Triggering Event:
Scenario:

The young doctor, rushing through the hospital corridor, feels her heart pounding against her ribcage. She's been called to an emergency, but all she can think about is the unexpected text from her ex-husband earlier today: "We need to talk." Her breath hitches as she pushes through the ICU doors, panic surging like adrenaline in her veins.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god I’m so worried! We have to be careful with that patient because he’s so fragile, I don’t want anything to go wrong. But what if he doesn’t make it? What if we mess up?! My mind won’t stop racing, thinking of every possible worst-case scenario. It’s so overwhelming I feel like I might throw up.

Triggering Event: She found his old, worn-out sneakers in her closet, still stained with mud from their last hike together. The empty house echoed with silence as she clutched them to her chest, tears spilling over onto the faded fabric.
Generated Assessment: She’s been holding it against him for months now, ever since he left her alone to watch the kids while he went out with friends. “How could you leave me like this? Did you even think about how I’d feel?” He just shrugged it off, saying he needed time to focus on himself and rebuild his confidence after years of being stuck at home. But he didn’t realize what it meant to her — leaving her alone when she was already feeling so lost after losing her job. Now, here she is, crying in front of the kids because some stupid sneakers remind her of the day he walked out on her. He always wore those fucking sneakers on hikes, but he never cleaned them up afterward. And now she can’t stand the smell of them anymore. They’re just sitting there, looking all pathetic and useless. What kind of man leaves his shit behind when he breaks up with someone? Doesn’t matter if it was an accident; he knew the kids would be upset seeing dirty shoes everywhere. Maybe he thought it was funny to see her freak out, but fuck no, he wasn’t laughing then. He looked so serious, like he had something important to say. But instead, he just turned around and kept walking, leaving her alone with two screaming kids and nothing but the stench of wet socks. I remember how happy we were on our hikes together. We always laughed, talked, and enjoyed each other's company. It feels like such a lie now, though.

Triggering Event: In the hushed silence of her empty classroom, she found herself absentmindedly tracing the heart someone had carved into the desk at the front row. The loneliness gnawed at her, echoing the hollow space in her own chest where love once resided. A lone raindrop tapped against the window, drawing her gaze upwards to the darkening sky. She sighed softly, feeling the familiar pang of sadness as she realized another anniversary had passed without him by her side.
Generated Assessment: Oh, what if I'd met him sooner? What if he hadn't left me so abruptly? What if we could have been together? The thought sent shivers down my spine, but it was a fleeting comfort. What if he still loved me? Would he forgive me for being there too late that day? What if we had grown old together? My mind wandered further down this rabbit hole, conjuring scenarios of what might have been. If I'd known then, would I have changed anything? Would I have tried harder to hold onto him? Could I have made things work? These were the questions that haunted me, each one leading down a path of regret. But the more I wondered, the more I felt lost. What if he never came back? What if he moved on with his life? What if he forgot about me? Each question led me deeper into despair. My thoughts swirled with possibilities, none of them ending well. Yet, I couldn’t help but cling to these hypotheticals, hoping they might bring some solace.
